linguistic.transcription: I mean, out of the jar. And he's given his little sister something. I don't know what it is. And one of the girls is washing the dishes and drying them. He's up there getting a, what's he getting down? Cookie jar. See, he's getting the cookie jar down, giving it to his sister. What is she doing?

interpretations.title: Lexical Richness
interpretations.text: The speaker's vocabulary is restricted, as evidenced by the use of vague words ("something", "what's he getting down?"). This feature may indicate word-finding issues or lack of vocabulary diversity, contributing to the model's prediction of cognitive impairment.

interpretations.title: Semantic Coherence
interpretations.text: The speaker's references are sometimes vague ("he's given his little sister something"), and ideas are not always clearly connected. This feature may indicate disorganized thinking or unclear meaning, contributing to the model's prediction of cognitive impairment.

interpretations.title: Difficulty with Spatial Reasoning and Visualization
interpretations.text: The speaker has trouble describing the location of objects ("the cookie jar is out there", "he's up there getting a..."), which may indicate difficulty with spatial reasoning and visualization, contributing to the model's prediction of cognitive impairment.

interpretations.title: Impaired Executive Function
interpretations.text: The speaker's speech is somewhat disorganized, with abrupt transitions between ideas ("And one of the girls is washing the dishes... The little boy's up on the footstool"). This feature may indicate poor sequencing or impaired executive function, contributing to the model's prediction of cognitive impairment.
